qa_multi_document_information_integratio.question: According to the judgment of Lakewood, Mayfield, Court and Riverton, Hamilton, Court, what are the occupations of the defendants X. Alvarez and H. Walker?
qa_multi_document_information_integratio.answer: According to the judgment of Lakewood, Mayfield, Court, the defendant X. Alvarez is a Delivery Driver; according to the judgment of Riverton, Hamilton, Court, the defendant H. Walker is Unemployed.

qa_multi_document_information_integratio.question: According to the judgment of Lakewood, Mayfield, Court and Riverton, Hamilton, Court, what crimes did the defendants X. Alvarez and H. Walker commit respectively?

content: The Court charges X. Alvarez with the Crime of Traffic Accident, in violation of Article 133 of the relevant penal code.
Under Article 170, H. Walker is charged with the Crime of Counterfeiting Currency.

qa_multi_document_information_integratio.answer: According to the judgment of Lakewood, Mayfield, Court, the defendant X. Alvarez committed the Crime of Traffic Accident; according to the judgment of Riverton, Hamilton, Court, the defendant H. Walker committed the Crime of Counterfeiting Currency.

qa_multi_document_information_integratio.question: According to the judgment of Lakewood, Mayfield, Court and Riverton, Hamilton, Court, who were the chief judges presiding over the cases of X. Alvarez and H. Walker?
qa_multi_document_information_integratio.answer: According to the judgment of Lakewood, Mayfield, Court, the chief judge presiding over the case of X. Alvarez was W. Hernandez; according to the judgment of Riverton, Hamilton, Court, the chief judge presiding over the case of H. Walker was Z. Rodriguez.

qa_multi_document_compare.question: According to the judgment of Lakewood, Mayfield, Court and Riverton, Hamilton, Court, whose sentencing time is longer, X. Alvarez or H. Walker?

content: The court sentences X. Alvarez to a fixed-term imprisonment of three (3) years.

Additionally, upon release, he will be subject to a probation period of one (1) year, during which he must comply with specific legal and rehabilitative conditions intended to monitor and correct his behavior.
Walker is sentenced to eight years of imprisonment, coupled with a monetary fine of $20,000.

qa_multi_document_compare.answer: X. Alvarez was sentenced to 3 years of fixed-term imprisonment with an additional 1-year probation period after release, while H. Walker was sentenced to 8 years imprisonment and a fine of $20,000. H. Walker's sentencing time is longer.

qa_multi_document_compare.question: According to the judgment of Lakewood, Mayfield, Court and Riverton, Hamilton, Court, whose judgment time is earlier, X. Alvarez or H. Walker?
